intro: Cyclosorus lobatus, commonly known as the hairy bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, leafless stems and specialized bladder-like structures used for capturing small aquatic organisms. The plant is typically found in shallow, freshwater habitats such as ponds and ditches. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually greenish-white in color. Cyclosorus lobatus plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling and providing habitat for microorganisms.
